intro: Tetrastigma schraderi-montis, commonly known as the mountain tetrastigma, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae, which includes grapes and other vine species. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research and horticultural study.
